Notes: Fatally shot by soldiers after he opened fire at them while troops entered the village.

Name: Amir 'Atef Khader Rayan
Notes: Mentally disabled. Critically wounded by soldiers’ gunfire after, according to the military, he ran towards a bus station where civilians and soldiers were waiting while brandishing a knife. Died of his wounds a short while later at a hospital in Israel. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Muhammad 'Issa Mustafa A'bbas
Notes: Wounded in the back by soldiers who fired from a military vehicle while he was traveling in a car in the town. B’Tselem’s investigation indicates that, contrary to the military’s claim, no shots were fired at the military vehicle from the car in which he was traveling. Died of his wounds a short while later.

Name: Hikmat 'Abd al-'Aziz Muhammad 'Abd al-'Aziz
Notes: Shot by soldiers after, according to the military, he ran into a military jeep standing near a military watchtower with his car. After the collision, both vehicles caught fire. His body was found in the car after the fire was extinguished. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Jamil Muhammad Faraj Sa'id al-Kayal
Notes: Fatally shot in the back by officers from the Border Police’s undercover unit after he hurled an IED at them from a distance of about 100 meters, while soldiers and undercover officers were entering the city.

Name: Jamil Jamal Ahmad Abu 'Ayash
Notes: Wounded in the head by soldiers’ gunfire from a distance of about 200 meters away during a protest against the establishment of the Evyatar outpost on town land, during stone-throwing at the troops. Died of his wounds a short while later.

Name: Muhammad Nidal Yunes Musa
Notes: Shot by security guards from the Ministry of Defense’s Crossing Authority at the Tulkarm/al-Kafriyat Checkpoint after, according to the ministry, he ran into one of the guards with his car and severely wounded him. In video footage published by the media, a guard is seen shooting at the car in which Musa was driving after it hit the security screening station at the checkpoint. Succumbed to his wounds at a hospital in Israel later that day. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Muhammad Shawkat Muhammad Salimeh
Notes: Fatally shot by Border Police officers near Damascus Gate after stabbing an Israeli civilian and attempting to stab police officers. According to media reports, the civilian sustained moderate injuries. In video footage published by the media, the officers are seen continuing to shoot Salimeh as he lies injured on the ground. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Fadi Mahmoud 'Abed Abu Skhidem
Notes: Fatally shot by Israel Police and Border Police officers near Bab a-Silsila (the Chain Gate), one of the entrances to the al-Aqsa compound, after opening fire at them and at Israeli civilians. An Israeli civilian was fatally wounded by the shooting and died of his wounds a short while later. According to media reports, two other Israeli civilians were wounded – one critically and one lightly – and two Border Police officers were lightly injured by shrapnel.

Name: Sadam Hussein 'Abd al-Wali Bani 'Odeh
Notes: Shot in the shoulder by soldiers. According to the military, soldiers fired at a passing vehicle from which an explosive device had been thrown at them, during the entry of soldiers into the town. B’Tselem’s inquiry found no signs of gunfire on Bani ‘Odeh’s vehicle.

Name: Muhammad Amjad Salem Da'das
Notes: Wounded in the abdomen by soldiers’ gunfire from several dozen meters away during stone-throwing at the soldiers. Died of his wounds a short while later.

Name: Amjad Ousamah Jalal Abu Sultan
Notes: Shot and wounded by soldiers lying in ambush after, according to the military, he hurled a Molotov cocktail at Route 60 along with another Palestinian teen, who was arrested. Died of his wounds later that day. Israel held his body until 20 November 2021.

Name: 'Alaa Naser Muhammad Zyud
Notes: Fatally shot by officers from an undercover Border Police unit after firing at them as soldiers and undercover police entered to the town. B’Tselem’s investigation found that the officers fired several more bullets at him while he was lying on the ground.

Name: Muhammad Muhammad 'Abd al-Karim Abu 'Ammar
Notes: Shot in the neck by soldiers while hunting birds several dozen meters from the perimeter fence.

Name: Israa Khaled 'Aref Khzeimiyyah
Notes: Wounded by Israel Police and Border Police officers’ gunfire near Bab a-Silsila, one of the entrances to the al-Aqsa compound, after, according to the police, she tried to stab them. Succumbed to her wounds a short while later. Israel held her body until 19 November 2021.

Name: Mahmoud Mustafa 'Abd al-Fatah Hmeidan
Notes: Fatally shot by Special Police Force officers along with two other Hamas military wing operatives after, according to the police, opening fire at them. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Ahmad Ibrahim Musa Zahran
Notes: Fatally shot by Special Police Force officers along with two other Hamas military wing operatives after, according to the police, opening fire at them. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Zakaria Ibrahim Saleh Badwan
Notes: Fatally shot by Special Police Force officers along with two other Hamas military wing operatives after, according to the police, opening fire at them. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Ousamah Yasser Muhammad a-Subuh
Notes: Fatally shot by officers from an undercover Border Police unit while throwing stones at a military vehicle when soldiers and unit officers entered the town. A Palestinian teen was shot to death shortly before.

Name: Yusef Muhammad Fathi 'Odeh
Notes: Fatally shot by officers from an undercover Border Police unit after firing at them when soldiers and unit officers entered the town. A Palestinian teen was shot to death shortly before. Israel is holding is body.

Name: Muhammad 'Ali Muhammad Khabisah
Notes: Shot in the head by security forces during a demonstration against the establishment of the Evyatar outpost on town land, during which he threw stones at security forces.

Name: Hazem al-Julani
Notes: Severely wounded by a police officer’s gunfire when he tried to stab him near Bab al- Majles. According to the police, a Border Police officer was lightly wounded by the shrapnel. Al-Julani succumbed to his wounds a short while later. Israel held his body until 20 December 2021.

Name: Ahmad Mustafa Mahmoud Saleh
Notes: Wounded in the abdomen by soldiers’ gunfire during a “Nightly Confusion” protest near the perimeter fence east of Jabalya Refugee Camp, during which Palestinians threw stones and hurled explosives at soldiers. Succumbed to his wounds a short while later.

Name: Raed Yusef Rashed Jadallah
Notes: Shot and wounded in the waist by soldiers lying in ambush, while walking home on the road to Beit ‘Ur a-Tahta, the turn-off to which from Route 443 has been blocked by Israel. Succumbed to his wounds a short while later.

Name: 'Imad Khaled Saleh Al-Hashash
Notes: Fatally shot in the head by soldiers while standing on his roof, as the latter were withdrawing from the camp.

Name: Ousamah Khaled Muhammad D'eij
Notes: Wounded by security forces’ gunfire during a demonstration near the perimeter fence in which Palestinians threw stones and hurled explosives at them. A Palestinian teen and a Border Police officer who were shot during the demonstration died of their wounds in the following days.

Name: 'Omar Hassan Musa Abu a-Nil
Notes: Wounded in the neck by security forces’ gunfire while standing about 100 meters from the perimeter fence during a demonstration in which Palestinians threw stones and hurled explosives at them. A Palestinian teen and a Border Police officer who were shot during the demonstration died of their wounds in the following days.

Name: Saleh Ahmad Mahmoud 'Ammar
Notes: Fatally shot by Border Police officers along with three other Palestinians, one of whom was a Hamas military wing operative and the other an Islamic Jihad military wing operative, during an exchange of fire following the entry of security forces into the refugee camp. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Nur a-Din 'Abd al-Ilah Muhammad Jarar
Notes: Fatally shot by Border Police officers along with three other Palestinians, one of whom was a Hamas military wing operative, during an exchange of fire following the entry of security forces into the refugee camp. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Amjad Iyad 'Azmi Hasaniyah
Notes: Fatally shot by Border Police officers along with three other Palestinians, one of whom was an Islamic Jihad military wing operative, during an exchange of fire following the entry of security forces into the refugee camp. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Raed Ziad 'Abd a-Latif Abu Seif
Notes: Fatally shot by Border Police officers along with three other Palestinians, one of whom was a Hamas military wing operative and the other an Islamic Jihad military wing operative, during an exchange of fire following the entry of security forces into the refugee camp. Israel is holding his body.

Name: 'Imad 'Ali Muhammad Dweikat
Notes: Fatally shot in the chest by Israeli security forces from hundreds of meters away during a demonstration against the establishment of the Evyatar outpost on town land, during which Palestinians burned tires and hurled stones at the forces.

Name: Diaa' A-Din Muhammad Subhi Samad'ah
Notes: Wounded in the thighs and hand by Special Police Unit officers’ gunfire in an exchange of fire when security forces entered the town.

Name: Shawkat Khaled 'Abdallah Za'aqiq
Notes: Wounded by security forces’ gunfire from a distance of about 100 meters in clashes that erupted during the funeral of a child from the village who was killed by soldiers’ gunfire the previous day. Za'aqiq threw stones during the clashes.

Name: Muhammad Muayad Bahajat Abu Sarah
Notes: Wounded in the upper body when soldiers fired from a distance of about 30 meters at the car he was traveling in with his family, as it was driving away from them. Succumbed to his wounds later that day.

Name: Shadi 'Omar Lutfi Salim
Notes: Wounded by soldiers’ gunfire near the water mains of the town of Beita. The day after the shooting, metal plumbing tools were found at the scene. Salim, who worked as a plumber, had come there several times before to fix the mains. He succumbed to his wounds shortly after. Israel held his body until 10 August 2021.

Name: Muhammad Munir Muhammad Tamimi
Notes: Wounded in the back and backside by soldiers’ fire from a distance of about 30 meters, after throwning stones at them while soldiers entered the village. Succumbed to his wounds later that day.

Name: Muhammad Farid 'Ali Hassan
Notes: Wounded in the shoulder by soldiers’ fire as he was throwing stones at them from the roof of his brother’s house during an invasion into the village by settlers and soldiers. During the invasion, settlers attacked this and other houses with stones. Soldiers withheld medical treatment for about ten minutes. Israel held on to his body until August 3, 2021.

Name: Mai Khaled Yusef 'Afanah
Notes: Fatally shot by soldiers after she tried to run them over and, according to the military, got out of the car brandishing a knife. Israel held her body until 23 August 2022.

Name: Ahmad Zahi Ibrahim Bani Shamsah
Notes: Wounded in the back of the head by soldiers’ gunfire at a site where Palestinians protest the establishment of the Evyatar outpost on town land, after hanging a Palestinian flag on a tree.

Name: Ibtesam Khaled Saleh Ka'abneh
Notes: Fatally shot by a security guard at Qalandiya Checkpoint after, according to the police, advancing towards security guards and Border Police officers while brandishing a knife. Israel held her body until 23 July 2021.

Name: Muhammad Sa'id Muhammad Hamayel
Notes: Fatally shot by soldiers during a demonstration against the establishment of the Evyatar outpost on town land, during which Palestinians burned tires and hurled stones at the soldiers.

Name: Jamil Bassem Ibrahim 'Amuri
Notes: Shot from behind by Special Police Unit officers as he was escaping from his car after the officers blocked him from driving away. Another Palestinian passenger who was in the car was injured by the shooting. According to the police, the two had opened fire at the officers. ‘Amuri was left lying on the ground without medical treatment for at least half an hour. During an ensuing exchange of fire between Israeli forces and PA military intelligence officers, two of the latter were killed and a third wounded. Israel is holding the body of ‘Amuri, who was an Islamic Jihad’s military wing operative.

Name: Taysir Mahmoud 'Othman 'Ayasah
Notes: PA military intelligence officer. Fatally shot along with another military intelligence officer in an exchange of fire with Israeli Special Police Unit officers and soldiers. A third military intelligence officer was injured in the exchange. The Israeli forces, who were trying to arrest two Palestinians, killed one of them, an Islamic Jihad military wing operative, by shooting him from behind while he was escaping from his car, and injured the other after, according to the police, they fired at the officers.

Name: Adham Yasser Tawfiq 'Ileiwi
Notes: PA military intelligence officer. Fatally shot along with another military intelligence officer in an exchange of fire with Israeli Special Police Unit officers and soldiers. A third military intelligence officer was injured in the exchange. The Israeli forces, who were trying to arrest two Palestinians, killed one of them, an Islamic Jihad military wing operative, by shooting him from behind while he was escaping from his car, and injured the other after, according to the police, they fired at the officers.

Name: Zakaria Maher 'Abd al-Hamid Fallah
Notes: Shot in the chest by soldiers during a demonstration against the establishment of the Evyatar outpost on town lands, during which Palestinians burned tires and hurled stones at soldiers.

Name: Ahmad Jamil Ibrahim 'Abdu
Notes: Wounded in an extrajudicial killing by Special Police Unit officers while sitting in his parked car. The officers blocked him from driving away, approached the car and immediately opened fire at ‘Abdu, who was not endangering them. They dragged him out of the car and left without extending him first aid. Succumbed to his wounds a short while later.

Name: Zuhdi Muhannad Zuhdi a-Tawil
Notes: Fatally shot by Israel Police and Border Police officers after stabbing a soldier and an Israeli civilian, moderately injuring them, at a light rail station in the city. In video footage posted on social media, the officers are seen firing at him as he lies wounded on the ground. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Huda Salah Rabi' al-Khazandar
Notes: Killed at her home, which was hit in an attack on a neighbors’ house. Her husband, son, and 10 other people were injured in the incident.

Name: Myasarah 'Abd a-Shakur Musbah al-'Ar'ir
Notes: Killed with another Hamas military wing operative while traveling in a car in the a-Saftawi neighborhood.

Name: 'Omar Ahmad Muhammad Jundiyah
Notes: Killed with another Hamas military wing operative while traveling in a car in the a-Saftawi neighborhood.

Name: Hashem Shaher Muhammad a-Shurafa
Notes: Killed while he was with other operatives from the military wing of an armed Palestinian group.

Name: Yusef Muhammad 'Abd al-Qader Abu Hussein
Notes: A broadcaster on Hamas' al-Aqsa Radio. Killed at home. Another missile was fired at his car, which was parked by the house.

Name: Yasser 'Atiyyah Muhammad al-Masri
Notes: Senior operative in the military wing of the Islamic Jihad. Wounded in the head by shrapnel from a missile that hit the ground near his house while he was inside.

Name: 'Ammar 'Abdallah Fawzi a-Nazer
Notes: Killed while he was with other people in the town.

Name: Dima Sa'ed 'Ali 'Asaliyah
Notes: Killed near her home, while she was on her way to fetch a pot from her older sister's house.

Name: 'Omar Muhammad Amin al-Mankush
Notes: Killed along with another Islamic Jihad military wing operative in a house in the a-Rimal neighborhood.

Name: Hassan Muhammad 'Ali Salem
Notes: Killed along with another Islamic Jihad military wing operative in a house in the a-Rimal neighborhood.

Name: Raed Zakaria Muhammad Hamad
Notes: Activist in the Popular Front for the Liberation Of Palestine who was burned to death when a shell hit his room and started a fire.

Name: Wafa 'Abd a-Rahman 'Abd a-Razeq Barad'i
Notes: Fatally shot by soldiers after opening fire at soldiers and civilians at the entrance to a settlement. In video footage posted on social media, gunfire is heard lasting after Barad’i is already lying wounded on the ground. Israel is holding her body.

Name: Hassan Sami Hassan al-Burno
Notes: Killed while watering an okra field.

Name: Islam Wael Fahmi Dar Naser
Notes: Wounded in the back of the head by soldiers’ gunfire during stone-throwing at other soldiers near the Separation Barrier west of the village. The shooters emerged from an ambush at a distance of about 40 meters away from Nasser, on the other side of the barrier. Succumbed to his wounds a short while later.

Name: Muntasser Mahmoud Zidan Zidan
Notes: Wounded in the head by soldiers who fired from the roof of a house about 200 meters away, after he had participated in a demonstration in the village in which Palestinians hurled stones at the soldiers and then had moved away from the center of the demonstration.

Name: Mahmoud Ramadan 'Omar Shteiwi
Notes: Killed on farmland behind his house in the a-Zeitun neighborhood.

Name: Ousamah Ashraf Muhammad Abu Raidah
Notes: Injured at the entrance to his home when a nearby shack was bombed.

Name: Adham Fayez Musa Kashef
Notes: Wounded in the back by soldiers’ gunfire during a demonstration near the Beit El/DCO Checkpoint in which he threw stones at the soldiers. Succumbed to his wounds a short while later. Another Palestinian was injured in the protest and also succumbed to his wounds soon after.

Name: Muhammad Muhammad Ishaq Hamid
Notes: Shot in the chest by soldiers during a demonstration near the Beit El/DCO Checkpoint. Succumbed to his wounds a short while later. Another Palestinian was injured in the protest and also succumbed to his wounds soon after.

Name: Islam Ghayad Muhammad Zahdah
Notes: Fatally shot by soldiers near the checkpoint at Gross Square after, according to the military, hurling Molotov cocktails at them. The shooting activated an explosive device he was carrying on his body. Israel is holding the body of Zahadah, who was an Islamic Jihad military wing operative.

Name: 'Ali Walid al-'Abed Brreis
Notes: Killed with three other Hamas military wing operatives by a cafeteria on the beach in western Gaza City. The taxi driver who had driven them was killed in an earlier attack on the vehicle.

Name: Muhammad Hassan Hassan Abu Sem'an
Notes: Killed with three other Hamas military wing operatives by a cafeteria on the beach in western Gaza City. The taxi driver who had driven them was killed in an earlier attack on the vehicle.

Name: Ahmad Khalil Hijazi a-Loh
Notes: Killed with three other Hamas military wing operatives by a cafeteria on the beach in western Gaza City. The taxi driver who had driven them was killed in an earlier attack on the vehicle.

Name: Muhammad Jamal 'Ali Abu Sem'an
Notes: Killed with three other Hamas military wing operatives by a cafeteria on the beach in western Gaza City. The taxi driver who had driven them was killed in a previous attack on the vehicle.

Name: Adib Sa'id Dib a-Surani
Notes: Taxi driver. Killed while driving four Hamas military wing operatives to a cafeteria on the beach in western Gaza City. The four operatives were killed in a later attack.

Name: Rafif Murshed Kamel Abu Dayer
Notes: Killed with her uncle in her yard as she was about to have lunch, after the uncle and his family had fled there, in an airstrike on the a-Shawa building on al-Wehda Street opposite the house. The strike destroyed the two top floors of the a-Shawa building, which held NGO offices.

Name: Ziad Kamel 'Abdallah Abu Dayer
Notes: Killed as he was about to have lunch in the yard of his brother's house, where he was sheltering with his wife and son, in an airstrike on the a-Shawa building on al-Wehda Street opposite the house. His niece, a minor, was also killed. The strike destroyed the two top floors of the a-Shawa building, which held NGO offices.

Name: Ahmad Ziad Hussein Sabah
Notes: Killed with a Hamas military wing operative at Hamudah Square in the town.

Name: Muhammad Nazir Muhammad Abu 'On
Notes: Killed with an Islamic Jihad military wing operative at Hamudah Square in the town.

Name: Yusef Rafiq Isma'il al-Baz
Notes: Killed while he was at a car wash next to his home with his father and his brother, a minor, who was injured in the attack.

Name: Husam Muhammad 'Othman Abu Harbid
Notes: Killed in an airstrike on a building that had been vacated by the occupants.

Name: 'Obaydah Akram 'Abd a-Rahman Jawabreh
Notes: Shot in the chest by soldiers after hurling Molotov cocktails at them near the entrance to the refugee camp.

Name: Fawaz Amin Muhammad al-Kolak
Notes: Killed with his parents, sister, wife, his three children, his daughter-in-law and four-month-old grandson, his sister-in-law and three of her children, three of them minors, as well as eight people from their extended family who lived in two adjoining buildings, including five minors. In another nearby building, owned by the Abu al-'Oaf family, 22 people were killed, including nine minors. In a fourth building located about 500 meters from the others, two occupants were killed. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Amin Muhammad Hamad al-Kolak (al-Qolaq)
Notes: Killed with his wife, son, daughter, two daughters-in-law, six of their grandchildren, including two minors, their grandson's wife, and their four-month-old great-grandson, as well as eight people from their extended family who lived in two adjoining buildings, including five minors. In another nearby building, owned by the Abu al-'Oaf family, 22 people were killed, including nine minors. In a fourth building located about 500 meters from the others, two occupants were killed. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Sa'diyah Yusef Taher al-Kolak (al-Qolaq)
Notes: Killed with her husband, son, daughter, two daughters-in-law, six of their grandchildren, including two minors, their grandson's wife and their four-month-old great-grandson, as well as eight people from their extended family who lived in two adjoining buildings, including five minors. In another nearby building, owned by the Abu al-'Oaf family, 22 people were killed, including nine minors. In a fourth building located about 500 meters from the others, two occupants were killed. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Bahaa Amin Muhammad al-Kolak (al-Qolaq)
Notes: Killed with her parents, brother, two sisters-in-law, six of her nephews, two of them minors, her nephew's wife and the four-month-old son of one of the nephews, as well as eight people from their extended family who lived in two adjoining buildings, including five minors. In another nearby building, owned by the Abu al-'Oaf family, 22 people were killed, including nine minors. In a fourth building located about 500 meters from the others, two occupants were killed. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: 'Abir Nimer 'Ali Ishkuntana
Notes: Killed at home with her four children, between the ages of two and nine, in a building owned by the Abu al-'Oaf family in which 17 other people were killed, including six minors. In addition, 22 members of the al-Qoolaq (Kolak) family were killed, six of them minors including a four-month-old baby, who lived in two adjoining buildings. Two other people were killed in a fourth building about 500 meters away. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Tawfiq Ayman Tawfiq Abu al-'Oaf
Notes: Killed at home with his parents, sister, grandparents, four other people from his extended family, and 12 other occupants, including nine minors, in a residential building owned by the family. Twenty-two members of the al-Qoolaq (Kolak) family, six of them minors, including a four-month-old baby, were killed in two adjacent buildings. Two more people were killed in a fourth building about 500 meters away. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Tawfiq Isma'il Hussein Abu al-'Oaf
Notes: Killed at home with his wife, their son, their daughter-in-law and two of their grandchildren, both minors, as well as four people from their extended family and 12 other occupants, including eight minors, in a building owned by the family. Twenty-two members of the al-Qoolaq (Kolak) family, six of them minors, including a four-month-old baby, were killed in two adjacent buildings. Two more people were killed in a fourth building about 500 meters away. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Lana Riyad Hassan Ishkuntana
Notes: Killed at home with her mother, two brothers and sister, all minors, in a building owned by the Abu al-'Oaf family in which 17 other people were killed, including five minors. In addition, 22 members of the al-Qoolaq (Kolak) family were killed, six of them minors including a four-month-old baby, who lived in two adjoining buildings. Two other people were killed in a fourth building about 500 meters away. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Ayman Tawfiq Isma'il Abu al-'Oaf
Notes: Killed at home with his wife and their two children, both minors, his parents, four other people from his extended family, and 12 other occupants, including eight minors, in a residential building owned by the family. Twenty-two members of the al-Qoolaq (Kolak) family, six of them minors, including a four-month-old baby, were killed in two adjacent buildings. Two more people were killed in a fourth building about 500 meters away. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Dana Riyad Hassan Ishkuntana
Notes: Killed at home with her mother, two brothers and two sisters, all minors, in a building owned by the Abu al-'Oaf family in which 17 other people were killed, including three minors. In addition, 22 members of the al-Qoolaq (Kolak) family were killed, six of them minors including a four-month-old baby, who lived in two adjoining buildings. Two other people were killed in a fourth building about 500 meters away. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Du'aa 'Omar 'Abdallah al-Kolak (al-Qolaq)
Notes: Killed with her husband, two of their children, both of them minors, her brother-in-law and three of their children, all minors, and 14 other people from her husband's extended family, including three minors, who lived in two adjoining buildings. In another nearby building, owned by the Abu al-'Oaf family, 22 people were killed, including nine minors. In a fourth building located about 500 meters from the others, two occupants were killed. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Amal Jamil Salamah al-Kolak (al-Qolaq)
Notes: Killed with three of her children, two of them minors, her in-laws, her brother-in-law and sister-in-law, and 14 other people from her extended family, including three minors, who lived in two adjoining buildings. In another nearby building, owned by the Abu al-'Oaf family, 22 people were killed, including nine minors. In a fourth building located about 500 meters from the others, two occupants were killed. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Rula Muhammad Mu'in al-Kolak (al-Qolaq)
Notes: Killed with her father and two sisters, both of them minors, her uncle, his wife and their two children, both minors, as well as 14 other people from her extended family, including three minors, who lived in two adjoining buildings. In another nearby building, owned by the Abu al-'Oaf family, 22 people were killed, including nine minors. In a fourth building located about 500 meters from the others, two occupants were killed. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Taher Shukri Amin al-Kolak (al-Qolaq)
Notes: Killed with his brother and sister, both of them minors, his mother, two of his uncles, his grandparents, and 14 other people from his extended family, including three minors, who lived in two adjoining buildings. In another nearby building, owned by the Abu al-'Oaf family, 22 people were killed, including nine minors. In a fourth building located about 500 meters from the others, two occupants were killed. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Ahmad Shukri Amin al-Kolak (al-Qolaq)
Notes: Killed with his sister, who was a minor, his brother, his mother, two of his uncles and his grandparents, as well as 14 other people from his extended family, including three minors, who lived in two adjoining buildings. In another nearby building, owned by the Abu al-'Oaf family, 22 people were killed, including nine minors. In a fourth building located about 500 meters from the others, two occupants were killed. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Hanaa Shukri Amin al-Kolak (al-Qolaq)
Notes: Killed with her mother and two brothers, one of them a minor, two of her uncles, her grandparents, and 14 other people from her extended family, including three minors, who lived in two adjoining buildings. In another nearby building, owned by the Abu al-'Oaf family, 22 people were killed, including nine minors. In a fourth building located about 500 meters from the others, two occupants were killed. Name: Yara Muhammad Mu'in al-Kolak (al-Qolaq)
Notes: Killed with her father and two sisters, both of them minors, her uncle, his wife and their two children, both minors, as well as 14 other people from her extended family, including three minors, who lived in two adjoining buildings. Notes: Killed with his wife, two of their children, both of them minors, his brother and three of his children, all minors, as well as 14 other people from his extended family, including three minors, who lived in two adjoining buildings. In another nearby building, owned by the Abu al-'Oaf family, 22 people were killed, including nine minors. In a fourth building located about 500 meters from the others, two occupants were killed. Name: 'Abd al-Hamid Fawaz Amin al-Kolak
Notes: Killed with his father, grandparents, sister, brother, sister-in-law and her four-month-old son, aunt, the wives of his two uncles and the three children of one of them, including two minors,as well as eight people from their extended family who lived in two adjoining buildings, including five minors. In another nearby building, owned by the Abu al-'Oaf family, 22 people were killed, including nine minors. In a fourth building located about 500 meters from the others, two occupants were killed. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Sameh Fawaz Amin al-Kolak
Notes: Killed with his father, grandparents, his brother and sister, his wife and their four-month-old son, his aunt, the wives of his two uncles and the three children of one of them, including two minors, as well as eight people from their extended family who lived in two adjoining buildings, including five minors. Name: Ayat Ibrahim Khalil al-Kolak (al-Qolaq)
Notes: Killed with her husband, their four-month-old son, and 19 other people from her husband's extended family, including six minors, who lived in two adjoining buildings. In another nearby building, owned by the Abu al-'Oaf family, 22 people were killed, including nine minors. In a fourth building located about 500 meters from the others, two occupants were killed. Name: Qusai Sameh Fawaz al-Kolak
Notes: Killed with his parents, grandfather, great-grandparents, aunt and uncle, his great-aunt, his grandfather's brothers' two wives, one with her three children, including two minors, as well as eight people from their extended family who lived in two adjoining buildings, including five minors. In another nearby building, owned by the Abu al-'Oaf family, 22 people were killed, including nine minors. In a fourth building located about 500 meters from the others, two occupants were killed. Name: Muhammad Mu'in Muhammad al-Kolak (al-Qolaq)
Notes: Killed with three of his children, all of them minors, and his brother and sister-in-law and their two children, both minors, as well as 14 other people from his extended family, including three minors, who lived in two adjoining buildings. Notes: Killed with her father, grandparents, two brothers, a sister-in-law and her four-month-old son, two aunts, her uncle's wife and three of her children, two of them minors, as well as eight people from their extended family who lived in two adjoining buildings, including five minors. Notes: Killed with her father and two sisters, both of them minors, her uncle, his wife and their two children, both minors, as well as 14 other people from her extended family, including three minors, who lived in two adjoining buildings. Notes: Killed with her in-laws and 19 other people from their extended family, including eight minors, who lived in two adjoining buildings. Name: Subhiya Isma'il Hussein Abu al-'Oaf

Notes: Killed at home with her mother and sister, seven other members of her extended family and 12 other occupants, including 10 minors, in a building owned by the family. Name: Majdiyah Khalil Hussein Abu al-'Oaf

Name: Rajaa Subhi Isma'il al-Ifranji

Twenty-two members of the al-Qoolaq (Kolak) family, six of them minors, including a four-month-old baby, were killed in two adjacent buildings. Name: Amir Rami Riyad al-Ifranji

Two more people were killed in a fourth building about 500 meters away. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Yazan Rami Riyad al-Ifranji
Notes: Killed with his mother and his two sisters and brother, all minors, while visiting his mother's relatives in a building owned by the extended family, in which 17 other people, including six minors, were killed. Twenty-two members of the al-Qoolaq (Kolak) family, six of them minors, including a four-month-old baby, were killed in two adjacent buildings. Two more people were killed in a fourth building about 500 meters away. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Mira Rami Riyad al-Ifranji
Notes: Killed with her mother, sister and two brothers, all minors, while visiting her mother's relatives in a building owned by the extended family, in which 17 other people, including six minors, were killed. Twenty-two members of the al-Qoolaq (Kolak) family, six of them minors, including a four-month-old baby, were killed in two adjacent buildings. Two more people were killed in a fourth building about 500 meters away. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Dima Rami Riyad al-Ifranji
Notes: Killed with her mother, sister and two brothers, all minors, while visiting her mother's relatives in a building owned by the extended family, in which 17 other people, including six minors, were killed. Twenty-two members of the al-Qoolaq (Kolak) family, six of them minors, including a four-month-old baby, were killed in two adjacent buildings. Two more people were killed in a fourth building about 500 meters away. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Hazem 'Adel Na'im al-Qumo'
Notes: Killed at home in a building owned by the Abu al-'Oaf family where 21 other people, including 10 minors, were killed. Twenty-two members of the al-Qoolaq (Kolak) family, six of them minors, including a four-month-old baby, were killed in two adjacent buildings. Two more people were killed in a fourth building about 500 meters away. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Muhammad Ahmad Musbah Iki
Notes: Killed in his store in a building owned by the Abu al-'Oaf family where 21 other people, including 10 minors, were killed. Twenty-two members of the al-Qoolaq (Kolak) family, six of them minors, including a four-month-old baby, were killed in two adjacent buildings. Two more people were killed in a fourth building about 500 meters away. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Mu'in Ahmad Hassan al-'Alul
Notes: Killed at home in the al-Ahlam building, about 500 meters away from the homes of the al-Qoolaq (Kolak) family. The airstrike killed another tenant in the building and 22 members of the al-Qoolaq family, including six minors, in two adjacent buildings, and 22 people, including 10 minors, in a building owned by the Abu al-'Oaf family. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Luai Muhammad Ahmad 'Odeh
Notes: Killed at home in the al-Ahlam building, about 500 meters away from the homes of the al-Qoolaq (Kolak) family. The airstrike killed another tenant in the building and 22 members of the al-Qoolaq family, including six minors, in two adjacent buildings, and 22 people, including 10 minors, in a building owned by the Abu al-'Oaf family. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Zein Riyad Hassan Ishkuntana
Notes: Killed at home with his mother, brother and two sisters, all minors, in a building owned by the Abu al-'Oaf family in which 17 other people were killed, including five minors. In addition, 22 members of the al-Qoolaq (Kolak) family were killed, six of them minors including a four-month-old baby, who lived in two adjoining buildings. Two other people were killed in a fourth building about 500 meters away. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Yihya Riyad Hassan Ishkuntana
Notes: Killed at home with his mother, brother and two sisters, all minors, in a building owned by the Abu al-'Oaf family in which 17 other people were killed, including five minors. In addition, 22 members of the al-Qoolaq (Kolak) family were killed, six of them minors including a four-month-old baby, who lived in two adjoining buildings. Two other people were killed in a fourth building about 500 meters away. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Diana Ziad Muhyi a-Din Abu al-'Oaf (al-Yazji)
Notes: Killed at home with her two daughters, seven members of her husband's extended family and 12 other occupants, including 10 minors, in a building owned by the family. Twenty-two members of the al-Qoolaq (Kolak) family, six of them minors, including a four-month-old baby, were killed in two adjacent buildings. Two more people were killed in a fourth building about 500 meters away. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Muhammad 'Awni 'Abdallah a-Z'anin
Notes: Killed with two other Islamic Jihad military wing operatives.

Name: Muhammad Yusef Mahmoud al-Kafarneh
Notes: Killed with two other Islamic Jihad military wing operatives.

Name: Mu'az Nabil Muhammad a-Z'anin
Notes: Killed with two other Islamic Jihad military wing operatives.

Name: Sameh Jihad Msameh al-Qadi
Notes: Killed on farmland with another Islamic Jihad military wing operative.

Name: Tareq Mahmoud Qassem al-Qadi
Notes: Killed on farmland with another Islamic Jihad military wing operative.

Name: Shaher Mahmoud Ahmad Abu Khadijeh
Notes: Fatally shot by Border Police officers after ramming them with his car at a police checkpoint at the entrance to the neighborhood of Sheikh Jarrah, injuring six. According to media reports, one officer sustained moderate injuries and the rest were lightly injured. Another officer sustained moderate injuries from the officers’ fire. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Khaled Salem Hassan al-Masalhah
Notes: Killed at home. His wife and son were injured.

Name: Tareq Ziad Mustafa Abu Hmeidan
Notes: Killed while he was with two other Hamas military wing operatives, who were injured in the attack.

Name: Ahmad Fayez Hassan 'Arafat
Notes: Killed while he was with another person, who was injured.

Name: Fadi Sadeq Musa Washahah
Notes: Wounded in the head by soldiers’ gunfire from a distance of several dozen meters during a demonstration near the Beit El/DCO Checkpoint, in which he hurled stones at the soldiers.

Name: Yasin Hassan Yasin Hamad
Notes: Shot in the chest by soldiers after crossing through a gap in the Separation Barrier during a demonstration in which Palestinians hurled stones at soldiers standing on the other side of the barrier.

Name: Muhammad Salem Yusef Abu 'Ayesh
Notes: Member of the Palestinian Authority security forces. Killed on farmland near the home of his wife's family.

Name: Yihya Bassem Ahmad al-'Ajleh
Notes: Killed near his home in an airstrike on the weekly Friday market. The strike also killed a 17-year-old who was at the entrance to his brother's home and an Islamic Jihad military wing operative who was near his home. Two other Palestinians in were injured in the strike.

Name: Seif a-Din Hani Muhammad Abu al-'Ata
Notes: Killed near his home by an airstrike on the weekly Friday market. The strike also killed a 17-year-old who was at the entrance to his brother's home and another Palestinian, who was injured near his home and succumbed to his wounds about two weeks later. Two other Palestinians were injured in the strike.

Name: Muhammad Ahmad 'Atiyyah Bhar
Notes: Killed at the entrance to his brother's home, where the family was sheltering, as he was leaving to go to a nearby grocery store, in an airstrike on the weekly Friday market. An Islamic Jihad military wing operative who was near the house was killed in the strike. A third Palestinian who was injured in the strike succumbed to his wounds about two weeks later. Two other Palestinians were injured in the strike.

Name: Sa'id Khaled Sa'id Abu Ghalyun
Notes: Killed while driving a car on al-'Ayun Street.

Name: Zaher 'Atiyyah Muhammad 'Anbar
Notes: Killed while riding a motorcycle in the eastern part of the refugee camp.

Name: Wajdi Walid 'Abdallah Ja'afrah
Notes: Wounded by soldiers’ gunfire after, according to the military, he tried to run them over at a flying checkpoint near the town.

Name: Yasmin Muhammad Khamis Abu Hatab
Notes: Killed at home with four of her children, all minors, and her sister-in-law and four of her children, all minors, who were staying with them. The house was completely destroyed and five nearby houses were partially destroyed. Yasmin's husband, 'Alaa Abu Hatab, is a Hamas military wing operative, but it is unkown whether he was the target of the attack.

Name: Yamen 'Alaa Muhammad Abu Hatab
Notes: Killed at home with his mother, his two brothers and his sister, all minors, and his aunt and four of her children, all minors, who were staying with them. The house was completely destroyed and five nearby houses were partially destroyed. His father, 'Alaa Abu Hatab, is a Hamas military wing operative, but it is unkown whether he was the target of the attack.

Name: Yihya Muhammad Subhi al-Hadidi
Notes: Killed with his mother and three of his siblings, all minors, as well as his aunt and four of her children, all minors, in an airstrike on the home of his uncle, 'Alaa Abu Khatab, a Hamas military wing operative, where they were staying.

Name: Yusef 'Alaa Muhammad Abu Hatab
Notes: Killed at home with his mother, his two brothers and his sister, all minors, and his aunt and four of her children, all minors, who were staying with them. The house was completely destroyed and five nearby houses were partially destroyed. His father, 'Alaa Abu Hatab, is a Hamas military wing operative, but it is unkown whether he was the target of the attack.

Name: Bilal 'Alaa Muhammad Abu Hatab
Notes: Killed at home with his mother, his two brothers and his sister, all minors, and his aunt and four of her children, all minors, who were staying with them. The house was completely destroyed and five nearby houses were partially destroyed. His father, 'Alaa Abu Hatab, is a Hamas military wing operative, but it is unkown whether he was the target of the attack.

Name: Maryam 'Alaa Muhammad Abu Hatab
Notes: Killed at home with her mother, her three brothers, all minors, and her aunt and four of her children, all minors, who were staying with them. The house was completely destroyed and five nearby houses were partially destroyed. Her father, 'Alaa Abu Hatab, is a Hamas military wing operative, but it is unkown whether he was the target of the attack.

Name: Maha Muhammad 'Abd al-'Aal al-Hadidi
Notes: Killed with four of her children, all minors, as well as her sister-in-law and four of her children, all minors, in an airstrike on the home of her sister-in-law and her brother, 'Alaa Abu Khatab, a Hamas military wing operative, where she was staying with her five children.

Name: Suhaib Muhammad Subhi al-Hadidi
Notes: Killed with his mother and four of his siblings, all minors, as well as his aunt and four of her children, all minors, in an airstrike on the home of his uncle, 'Alaa Abu Khatab, a Hamas military wing operative, where they were staying.

Name: 'Abd a-Rahman Muhammad Subhi al-Hadidi
Notes: Killed with his mother and three of his siblings, all minors, as well as his aunt and four of her children, all minors, in an airstrike on the home of his uncle, 'Alaa Abu Khatab, a Hamas military wing operative, where they were staying.

Name: Ousamah Muhammad Subhi al-Hadidi
Notes: Killed with his mother and three of his siblings, all minors, as well as his aunt and four of her children, all minors, in an airstrike on the home of his uncle, 'Alaa Abu Khatab, a Hamas military wing operative, where they were staying.

Name: Adam Muhammad 'Ali al-Far'awi
Notes: Sustained burns at home in the a-Rab'i building, when it was bombed. A 12-year-old boy, the son of a senior Islamic Jihad operative who lived in the building, was also killed in the strike.

Name: 'Abdallah Ashraf 'Abdallah Judah
Notes: Son of a senior Islamic Jihad operative. Killed at home in the a-Rabi' building, when it was bombed. An 18-year-old tenant in the building sustained severe burns and succumbed to his wounds the next day.

Name: Yusef Nawaf Hussein Muhareb
Notes: Wounded in the neck by soldiers’ gunfire during a demonstration while attempting to evacuate another man wounded by shots soldiers fired at demonstrators. The demonstrators threw stones at the soldiers, burned tires and shot flares. Muhareb remained paraplegic from the time of his injury until his death.

Name: Husam Baker Muhammad al-Hayah
Notes: Killed with another Hamas military wing operative in the neighborhood of a-Shuja'iyeh.

Name: Saqer 'Abd al-Majid Isma'il al-Hayah
Notes: Killed with another Hamas military wing operative in the neighborhood of a-Shuja'iyeh.

Name: Ahmad Muhammad 'Abd al-'Aziz Sabah
Notes: Killed with two brothers from the neighboring al-Mansi family, both Hamas military wing operatives, while they were rescuing relatives injured by a previous missile.

Name: Yusef Hatem Mahmoud al-Mansi
Notes: Killed with his brother and his neighbor, both Hamas military wing operatives, while they were rescuing relatives injured by a previous missile.

Name: Ahmad Hatem Mahmoud al-Mansi
Notes: Killed with his brother and his neighbor, both Hamas military wing operatives, while they were rescuing relatives injured by a previous missile.

Name: Muhammad Zein Muhammad Mahmoud al-'Attar
Notes: Nine months old. Killed at home with his mother, sister and brother. His father and 13 other occupants of the building were injured. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network passed by the house.

Name: Islam Muhammad Mahmoud al-'Attar
Notes: Killed at home with his mother, sister and nine-month-old brother. His father and 13 other occupants of the building were injured. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network passed by the house.

Name: Amirah Muhammad Mahmoud al-'Attar
Notes: Killed at home with her mother and two brothers, one of whom was nine months old. Her father and 13 other occupants of the building were injured. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network passed by the house.

Name: Lamyaa Hassan Muhammad al-'Attar
Notes: Killed at home with her three young children, including a nine-month-old baby. Her husband and 13 other occupants of the building were injured. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network passed by the house.

Name: Musa Ghaleb Ibrahim Madi
Notes: Killed while riding a motorcycle near al-Balbisi Square.

Name: Ahmad 'Awad Muhammad a-Nazer
Notes: Killed with another Islamic Jihad military wing operative on Yafa Street. Their bodies were found that evening.

Name: Ahmad Muhammad al-Mahdi Isma'il a-Najar
Notes: Killed with another Islamic Jihad military wing operative on Yafa Street. Their bodies were found that evening.

Name: Tareq 'Omar Ahmad Snobar
Notes: Shot in the chest by soldiers while Palestinians were throwing stones at them at the entrance to the village in protest of the establishment of the Evyatar outpost on village land and the Israeli fighting in the Gaza Strip.

Name: Sharif Khaled Muhammad Suliman
Notes: Fatally shot by soldiers during clashes at the entrance to the village, during which Palestinians hurled stones at passing cars.

Name: 'Issa Suliman Barham Barham
Notes: Wounded in the abdomen by soldiers’ gunfire while standing near his car during a demonstration against the establishment of the Evyatar outpost on town land, during which Palestinians hurled stones at soldiers. Succumbed to his wounds a short while later.

Name: Nizar Riyad M'aruf Abu Zeinah
Notes: Wounded in the chest by soldiers’ gunfire from about 100-150 meters away, during a demonstration in which Palestinians hurled stones at soldiers standing on the other side of the Separation Barrier. Succumbed to his wounds a short while later.

Name: Muhammad 'Adel Hassan Shqeirat
Notes: Shot in the chest by soldiers during a demonstration at the entrance to the refugee camp, during which Palestinians burned tires and hurled stones at the soldiers.

Name: Muhammad Rohi 'Abd al-Halim Hammad
Notes: Fatally shot in his car by a soldier at the entrance to a military post after, according to the military, he accelerated towards the soldier and then got out of the car and tried to stab him. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Malek Musbah Ahmad Hamdan
Notes: Shot in the chest by soldiers while fleeing from them, from a distance of several dozen meters, while Palestinians were throwing stones at them.

Name: Yusef Mahdi Mahmoud a-Nawasrah
Notes: Wounded in the waist by soldiers who fired at him from 100-200 meters away during a demonstration in which he hurled stones at them. Succumbed to his wounds a short while later.

Name: Husam Wael Musa 'Asayrah
Notes: Wounded in the chest by soldiers’ gunfire from about 200 meters during clashes that ensued after armed settlers invaded the village escorted by soldiers. Succumbed to his wounds a short while later.

Name: Walid Zuheir Muhammad Abu Shab
Notes: Killed while he was with other people on a street in the town. Another young man was injured in the attack.

Name: Fayzah Ahmad Muhammad Salamah
Notes: Killed at home. Her husband and son were injured. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network passed by the house.

Name: Mahmoud Muhammad Isma'il Khaled
Notes: Killed while walking along the street when four missiles were fired at the home of Ayman Nofal, a senior Hamas military wing operative. At least 10 other people were injured in the attack.

Name: Halimah 'Ali Muhammad al-Madhun
Notes: Killed at home along with her husband in an airstrike on nine homes near a-Sheikh Zayed Square. The bombing also killed six members of the a-Tanani family - the father, the pregnant mother, and their four children, who were minors - as they were trying to flee their home. A Hamas military wing operative who lived nearby was not home at the time of the attack.

Name: Isma'il Raafat Muhammad Isma'il a-Tanani
Notes: Killed along with his parents and his three brothers, who were minors, as they were trying to flee their home during an airstrike on nine homes near a-Sheikh Zayed Square. A couple from the al-Madhun family were also killed. A Hamas military wing operative who lived nearby was not home at the time of the attack.

Name: Adham Raafat Muhammad Isma'il a-Tanani
Notes: Killed along with his parents and his three brothers, who were minors, as they were trying to flee their home during an airstrike on nine homes near a-Sheikh Zayed Square. A couple from the al-Madhun family were also killed. A Hamas military wing operative who lived nearby was not home at the time of the attack.

Name: Rawyah Fathi Hassan a-Tanani
Notes: Killed while three months pregnant, along with her husband and their four children, who were minors, as they were trying to flee their home during an airstrike on nine homes near a-Sheikh Zayed Square. A Hamas military wing operative who lived nearby was not home at the time of the attack.

Name: Raafat Muhammad Isma'il 'Ata a-Tanani
Notes: Killed along with his pregnant wife and their four children, who were minors, as they were trying to flee their home during an airstrike on nine homes near a-Sheikh Zayed Square. A Hamas military wing operative who lived nearby was not home at the time of the attack.

Name: 'Abd a-Rahim Muhammad 'Abdallah al-Madhun
Notes: Killed at home along with his wife in an airstrike on nine homes near a-Sheikh Zayed Square. The bombing also killed six members of the a-Tanani family - the father, the pregnant mother, and their four children, who were minors - as they were trying to flee their home. A Hamas military wing operative who lived nearby was not home at the time of the attack.

Name: Amir Raafat Muhammad Isma'il a-Tanani
Notes: Killed along with his parents and his three brothers, who were minors, as they were trying to flee their home during an airstrike on nine homes near a-Sheikh Zayed Square. A couple from the al-Madhun family were also killed. A Hamas military wing operative who lived nearby was not home at the time of the attack.

Name: Muhammad Raafat Muhammad Isma'il a-Tanani
Notes: Killed along with his parents and his three brothers, who were minors, as they were trying to flee their home during an airstrike on nine homes near a-Sheikh Zayed Square. A couple from the al-Madhun family were also killed. A Hamas military wing operative who lived nearby was not home at the time of the attack.

Name: Hashem Muhammad 'Ayed a-Zgheibi
Notes: Killed while standing in his doorway by shelling of the Abu Fares family home nearby. Three sisters and an infant from the Abu Fares family, as well as another neighbor, were killed in the shelling.

Name: Muhammad Salamah Muhammad Abu Diyah
Notes: Nine months old. Killed with his mother and his two aunts at his grandfathers' house. Another neighbor was killed at home, as well as a neighbor who was standing in his doorway.

Name: Nisrin Naser Muhammad Abu Fares
Notes: Killed at home with her two sisters and her infant nephew. Another neighbor was killed at home, as well as a neighbor who was standing in his doorway.

Name: Fawzeyeh Naser Muhammad Abu Fares
Notes: Killed at home with her two sisters and her infant nephew. Another neighbor was killed at home, as well as a neighbor who was standing in his doorway.

Name: Ni'mah Saleh Salamah 'Ayash
Notes: Killed at home by shelling of the Abu Fares family home nearby. Three sisters and an infant from the Abu Fares family were killed, as well as another neighbor who standing in his doorway.

Name: Sabrin Naser Muhammad Abu Fares (Abu Diyah)
Notes: Killed with her infant son and her two sisters in their father's house. A neighbor who was at home and another neighbor who was standing in his doorway were also killed in the attack.

Name: Manar Khader Ahmad 'Issa
Notes: Killed at home with her daughter, a minor. Her husband and other people were injured.

Name: Lina Muhammad Mahmoud 'Issa
Notes: Killed at home with her mother. Her father and other people were injured.

Name: Firas 'Alaa Muhammad al-Bahri
Notes: Killed while he was with al-Mujahidin military wing operative, who was killed. Six other people were injured in the attack.

Name: Khaled 'Imad Khaled al-Qanu'
Notes: Killed while he was with another Palestinian who was injured and succumbed to his wounds about six days later. Six other people were injured in the attack.

Name: Ahmad Iyad Ahmad Fatuh
Notes: Killed while sitting in his yard with two of his brothers and other relatives, from an airstrike on a nearby shack and house that was under construction. His brothers, both minors, and another relative were injured in the airstrike.

Name: Siham Yusef Mahmoud a-Rantisi
Notes: Killed at home with her son, a Hamas military wing operative, with her daughter-in-law and with her infant grandson, in an airstrike on the extended family's residential building.

Name: Ibrahim Muhammad Ibrahim a-Rantisi
Notes: Six months old. Killed at home with his grandmother, with his uncle, a Hamas military wing operative, and with his uncle's wife, in an airstrike on the extended family's residential building.

Name: Raed Ibrahim Khamis a-Rantisi
Notes: Killed with his mother, wife and infant nephew in an airstrike on the extended family's residential building.

Name: Shaimaa Diab Muhammad a-Rantisi
Notes: Killed at home with her husband, a Hamas military wing operative, with her mother-in-law and with her infant nephew, in an airstrike on the extended family's residential building.

Name: Mustafa Hassan Ahmad al-A'bed
Notes: Killed with another Hamas military wing operative on a-Dahdhuh Street.

Name: 'Abd a-Rahman Esbitah Khalaf 'Azzam
Notes: Killed with another Hamas military wing operative on a-Dahdhuh Street.

Name: Muhammad Khaled 'Omar a-Tawashi
Notes: Killed on farmland behind his family's home.

Name: Hur Muamen Jamal a-Zamli
Notes: Killed at home with her mother, in an airstrike on the extended family's residential building. Nine members of the family were injured.

Name: Khulud Fouad Farhan a-Zamli
Notes: Killed at home with her infant daughter, in an airstrike on the extended family's residential building. Nine members of the family were injured.

Name: Hadil Muhammad Ibrahim Aman
Notes: Killed at home with her father and two of her sisters, one of whom was six months pregnant. Her mother, her two brothers and 25 other people were injured in the attack. A Hamas military wing operative who lived in the two-story building was away at the time, and it is unclear whether he was the target of the attack. A nearby four-story building was damaged.

Name: Walaa Muhammad Ibrahim Aman
Notes: Killed in her parents' home with her father and two of her sisters while six months pregnant. Her mother, her two brothers and 25 other people were injured in the attack. A Hamas military wing operative who lived in the two-story building was away at the time, and it is unclear whether he was the target of the attack. A nearby four-story building was damaged.

Name: Warda Muhammad Ibrahim Aman
Notes: Killed at home with her father and two of her sisters, one of whom was six months pregnant. Her mother, her two brothers and 25 other people were injured in the attack. A Hamas military wing operative who lived in the two-story building was away at the time, and it is unclear whether he was the target of the attack. A nearby four-story building was damaged.

Name: Muhammad Ibrahim Muhammad Aman
Notes: Killed at home with three of his daughters, one of whom was six months pregnant. His wife, his two sons and 25 other people were injured in the attack. A Hamas military wing operative who lived in the two-story building was away at the time, and it is unclear whether he was the target of the attack. A nearby four-story building was damaged.

Name: Ahmad Rami Mahmoud al-Hawajri
Notes: Killed with another Palestinian at the entrance to a grocery store in front of the Abu 'Iyada family's home, which was bombed while empty. Another person was injured.

Name: Muayad Taysir 'Abd a-Rahman al-Khatib
Notes: Killed along with a minor at the entrance to a grocery store in front of the Abu 'Iyada family's home, which was bombed while empty. Another person was injured.

Name: 'Abd al-'Aziz 'Abd al-Hamid 'Abd al-'Ati Abu Ta'imah
Notes: Killed while trying to launch rockets into Israeli territoy along with other Palestinian militants

Name: Yihya Mansur 'Ali Ghaban
Notes: Injured on farmland. A Palestinian farmer working in a nearby plot was killed in the attack.

Name: Suhaib 'Abd a-Rahim 'Awad Ghanem
Notes: Killed while working on farmland in an area where an Hamas military wing operative was present. The operative was injured in the attack and succumbed to his wounds about four days later.

Name: Ahmad Kamel 'Abd al-Karim 'Ammar
Notes: Killed while riding a motorcycle in the eastern part of the town. Succumbed to his wounds in hospital in Egypt.

Name: Mayami 'Abdallah Musa 'Arafah
Notes: Killed at home along with her daughter. Three members of the family were injured.

Name: Hadil Khaled Mahmoud 'Arafah
Notes: Killed at home along with her mother. Three members of the family were injured.

Name: Majed 'Abd Rabo Mahmoud Abu Sa'adah
Notes: Killed while talking on the street by his home with a cooking gas vendor who was sitting in a car.

Name: Mahmoud Ahmad Muhammad Abu 'Amer
Notes: Cooking gas vendor. Killed while sitting in his car and talking with a resident who was on the street.

Name: Nael Khaled Yunes al-Barawi
Notes: Killed along with three other farmers while loading onto a car peaches they had picked on a farm in the eastern part of the refugee camp. The farm's guard was injured.

Name: 'Atef 'Abd a-Rahman Jum'ah al-Barawi
Notes: Killed along with three other farmers while loading onto a car peaches they had picked on a farm in the eastern part of the refugee camp. The farm's guard was injured.

Name: Tal'at Jamil Mahmoud Warsh Agha
Notes: Killed along with three other farmers while loading onto a car peaches they had picked on a farm in the eastern part of the refugee camp. The farm's guard was injured.

Name: Wael Mahmoud Fares al-Ghulah
Notes: Killed along with three other farmers while loading onto a car peaches they had picked on a farm in the eastern part of the refugee camp. The farm's guard was injured.

Name: 'Abd a-Salam Mahmoud Nabih al-Ghazali
Notes: Killed along with his cousin on the street by his cousin’s sewing workshop, when a missile hit a nearby car. Another Palestinian who was on the street by his house and three of the car's passengers, including a husband and wife, were also killed in the strike. Two of the couple's children and another Palestinian on the street were injured.

Name: Mansur Yusef Hassan a-Darimli
Notes: Killed on the street by his house, when a missile hit a nearby car. Two cousins who were on the street by a tailor shop belonging to one of them were also killed, along with three of the car's passengers, including a husband and wife. Two of the couple's children and another Palestinian on the street were injured.

Name: Maysoun Zaki Hashem al-Hittu
Notes: Killed along with her husband and a taxi driver who was driving the couple and their son to their daughters' house. In the attack, three other Palestinians were killed on the street, one by his house, and two by a sewing workshop belonging to one of them. Two of her children were injured, and another Palestinian on the street was severely injured.

Name: Nader Muhammad Nabih al-Ghazali
Notes: Killed along with his cousin on the street by his sewing workshop, when a missile hit a nearby car. Another Palestinian who was on the street by his house and three of the car's passengers, including a husband and wife, were also killed in the strike. Two of the couple's children and another Palestinian on the street were injured.

Name: Sa'id Hashem Sa'id al-Hittu
Notes: Killed along with Sa'id and Maysoun al-Hittu while driving the couple and their son to their daughter's house in the a-Sabra neighborhood in his taxi. In the attack, three other Palestinians were killed on the street, one by his house, and two by a sewing workshop belonging to one of them. Two of the his children were injured, and another Palestinian on the street was severely injured.

Name: Mustafa Mazen Salem Kurdiyah
Notes: Killed along with Sa'id and Maysoun al-Hittu while driving the couple and their son to their daughter's house in the a-Sabra neighborhood in his taxi. In the attack, three other Palestinians were killed on the street, one by his house, and two by a sewing workshop belonging to one of them. Two of the couple's children were injured, and another Palestinian on the street was severely injured.

Name: 'Ammar Taysir Muhammad al-'Amur
Notes: Killed along with his cousin on their way home from a barbershop, after stopping by his uncle's grocery store to buy food. His 11-year-old brother was injured in the attack.

Name: Hamadah 'Atiyyah A'bed al-'Amur
Notes: Killed along with his cousin on their way home from a barbershop, after stopping by his father's grocery store to buy food. The cousin's 11-year-old brother was injured in the attack.

Name: Maryam Muhammad 'Odeh a-Talbani
Notes: Killed at home along with her mother and her brother, a minor, in an airstrike on their building. Her father was severely injured in the attack. Two senior Hamas military wing operatives who were in the building, as well as a minor who was in a nearby building, were killed. Her body was extracted about nine days after the attack.

Name: Hala Hussein Raafat a-Rifi
Notes: Killed at home in an airstrike on a nearby building in which three members of the a-Talbani family, including two minors, and two senior Hamas military wing operatives were killed.

Name: Hassan Muhammad Hassan al-Qahwaji
Notes: Senior Hamas military wing operative. Killed along with another senior military wing operative in a building in which three members of the a-Talbani family were also killed, including two minors. Another minor in a nearby building was killed in the attack.

Name: Wael 'Abd al-Karim 'Ali 'Issa
Notes: Senior Hamas military wing operative. Killed along with another senior military wing operative in a building in which three members of the a-Talbani family were also killed, including two minors. Another minor in a nearby building was killed in the attack.

Name: Rima Sa'ed Kamel a-Talbani
Notes: Killed at home along with her son and daughter, both minors, in an airstrike on their building. Her husband was severely injured in the attack. Two senior Hamas military wing operatives who were in the building, as well as a minor who was in a nearby building, were killed. Her daughter's body was extracted about nine days after the attack.

Name: Zeid Muhammad 'Odeh a-Talbani
Notes: Killed at home along with his mother and his sister, a minor, in an airstrike on their building. His father was severely injured in the attack. Two senior Hamas military wing operatives who were in the building, as well as a minor who was in a nearby building, were killed. His sister's body was extracted about nine days after the attack.

Name: Jum'ah 'Abdallah Muhammad a-Tahlah
Notes: Senior Hamas military wing operative. Killed in an airstrike on a tunnel along with 14 other military wing operatives, 11 of them senior operatives. Their bodies were extracted on 13 May 2021.

Name: Bassem Subhi Sha'ban 'Issa
Notes: Senior Hamas military wing operative. Killed in an airstrike on a tunnel along with 14 other military wing operatives, 11 of them senior operatives. Their bodies were extracted on 13 May 2021.

Name: Hazem Musbeh Ibrahim al-Khatib
Notes: Senior Hamas military wing operative. Killed in an airstrike on a tunnel along with 14 other military wing operatives, 11 of them senior operatives. Their bodies were extracted on 13 May 2021.

Name: Walid Musa Khaled Shmali
Notes: Senior Hamas military wing operative. Killed in an airstrike on a tunnel along with 14 other military wing operatives, 11 of them senior operatives. Their bodies were extracted on 13 May 2021.

Name: Jamal Muhammad Sa'id a-Zebdah
Notes: Senior Hamas military wing operative. Killed in an airstrike on a tunnel along with 14 other military wing operatives, 11 of them senior operatives. Their bodies were extracted on 13 May 2021.

Name: Zafer Mazen Zafer a-Shawa
Notes: Senior Hamas military wing operative. Killed in an airstrike on a tunnel along with 14 other military wing operatives, 11 of them senior operatives. Their bodies were extracted on 13 May 2021.

Name: Akram Muhammad 'Abd al-'Aal al-'Attar
Notes: Killed in an airstrike on a tunnel along with 14 other military wing operatives, 12 of them senior operatives. Their bodies were extracted on 13 May 2021.

Name: Mahmoud Muhammad Jamil Fares
Notes: Senior Hamas military wing operative. Killed in an airstrike on a tunnel along with 14 other military wing operatives, 11 of them senior operatives. Their bodies were extracted on 13 May 2021.

Name: Sami Sa'id Muhammad Radwan
Notes: Senior Hamas military wing operative. Killed in an airstrike on a tunnel along with 14 other military wing operatives, 11 of them senior operatives. Their bodies were extracted on 13 May 2021.

Name: Mujahed Majed Yusef al-Hadidi
Notes: Killed in an airstrike on a tunnel along with 14 other military wing operatives, 12 of them senior operatives. Their bodies were extracted on 13 May 2021.

Name: Ousamah Jamal Sa'id a-Zebdah
Notes: Senior Hamas military wing operative. Killed in an airstrike on a tunnel along with 14 other military wing operatives, 11 of them senior operatives. Their bodies were extracted on 13 May 2021.

Name: Nidal Habib Isma'il Hana
Notes: Senior Hamas military wing operative. Killed in an airstrike on a tunnel along with 14 other military wing operatives, 11 of them senior operatives. Their bodies were extracted on 13 May 2021.

Name: 'Awad Nabil Muhammad Abu Selmiyeh
Notes: Senior Hamas military wing operative. Killed in an airstrike on a tunnel along with 14 other military wing operatives, 11 of them senior operatives. Their bodies were extracted on 13 May 2021.

Name: Mustafa Muhammad Suliman Farhat
Notes: Killed in an airstrike on a tunnel along with 14 other military wing operatives, 12 of them senior operatives. Their bodies were extracted on 13 May 2021.

Name: Muhammad Sa'id Muhammad Abu al-'Ata
Notes: Senior Hamas military wing operative. Killed in an airstrike on a tunnel along with 14 other military wing operatives, 11 of them senior operatives. Their bodies were extracted on 13 May 2021.

Name: Muhammad Mu'in Muhammad al-Qar'ah
Notes: Killed with three other Islamic Jihad military wing operatives while trying to launch rockets into Israeli territory.

Name: Muhammad 'Abd al-Mun'im Ibrahim Shahin
Notes: Killed with three other Islamic Jihad military wing operatives while trying to launch rockets into Israeli territory.

Name: Hamzah Mahmoud Ibrahim al-Hur
Notes: Killed with three other Islamic Jihad military wing operatives while trying to launch rockets into Israeli territory.

Name: Ahmad Walid Hussein a-Tala'a
Notes: Killed with three other Islamic Jihad military wing operatives while trying to launch rockets into Israeli territory.

Name: Muhammad 'Omar Sa'id Najjar
Notes: Fatally shot by soldiers at a military post near the settlement of Yitzhar after, according to the military, he had fired at them and moderately injured two. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Hussein 'Atiyyah Hussein Titi
Notes: Shot in the chest on the roof of his home by Israeli snipers standing on a neighbor’s roof during a military raid into the camp. Four other residents were wounded by sniper fire during the incident. Soldiers also fired at the wheels of an ambulance carrying one of the wounded persons.

Name: Rashid Muhammad Rashid Abu 'Ara
Notes: Wounded in the back by two bullets fired by soldiers from within a military jeep, as he was fleeing from them after Palestinians had hurled stones at them. Succumbed to his wounds a short while later.

Name: Bashar Ahmad Ibrahim Samur
Notes: Fatally shot while working in a field by the perimeter fence east of Khan Yunis, along with two relatives.

Name: Muhammad Khalil Yunes Khalil Frejat
Notes: Wounded by soldiers’ gunfire during clashes in the city, in which Palestinians hurled stones and Molotov cocktails at soldiers.

Name: Ahmad Ibrahim Ahmad Abu Sakran
Notes: Killed at the doorway to his home along with his nephew, who was visiting, by a missile that landed there. His son and three other people, one of them a minor, were injured.

Name: Muhammad Nahed Jaber Abu Sakran
Notes: Killed along with his uncle at the doorway to the latter's home, by a missile that landed there. Four other people were injured.

Name: 'Iz a-Din Muhammad 'Abdallah Hiles
Notes: Killed while driving in his car with his brother, who was injured in the attack.

Name: Muhammad Jamil Ahmad Kalusah
Notes: Killed on a street in the city center when a military base and a public park in the al-Mahatah neighborhood were bombed.

Name: Muhammad 'Abd a-Ra'uf Muhammad Hiles
Notes: Injured at the entrance to his shop. Another store owner, his son and another Palestinian out on the street were injured in the attack. He succumbed to his wounds later that day.

Name: Muhammad Yihya Muhammad Abu al-'Ata
Notes: Senior Islamic Jihad military wing operative. Killed along with two other senior military wing operatives. Seven other Palestinians were injured.

Name: Kamal Taysir Salman Qreiqi'
Notes: Senior Islamic Jihad military wing operative. Killed along with two other senior military wing operatives. Seven other Palestinians were injured.

Name: Sameh Fahim Hashem al-Mamluk
Notes: Senior Islamic Jihad military wing operative. Killed along with two other senior military wing operatives. Seven other Palestinians were injured.

Name: Minnah Iyad Fathi Sharir
Notes: Injured in an attack on her family's two-story building, which collapsed. Her mother, her 15-year-old sister and her father, a senior Hamas military wing operative, were killed in the strike.

Name: Lina Iyad Fathi Sharir
Notes: Killed along with her mother and her father, a senior Hamas military wing operative, in an attack on their two-story building, which collapsed. Her toddler sister was injured in the strike and succumbed to her wounds about a week later.

Name: Iyad Fathi Fayeq Sharir
Notes: Senior Hamas military wing operative. Killed along with his wife and their 15-year-old daughter in an attack on their two-story building, which collapsed. His toddler daughter was injured in the strike and succumbed to her wounds about a week later.

Name: Layali Taha A'bbas Sharir
Notes: Killed along with her 15-year-old daughter and her husband, a senior Hamas military wing operative, in an attack on their two-story building, which collapsed. Her toddler daughter was injured in the strike and succumbed to her wounds about a week later.

Name: Munzer 'Abd al-Karim Muhammad Barakah
Notes: Killed along with his brother when the two came with their father to tend to their chicks, in a coop that lies on leased land.

Name: Manar 'Abd al-Karim Muhammad Barakah
Notes: Killed along with his brother when the two came with their father to tend to their chicks, in a coop that lies on leased land.

Name: 'Abd a-Rahman Yusef 'Ali Subuh
Notes: Had cerebral palsy. Killed along with his mother when a missile hit their sixth-floor apartment. Two other Palestinians were injured in the attack, one of them severely.

Name: Amirah 'Abd al-Fatah 'Abd a-Rahman Subuh
Notes: Killed along with her son, who had cerebral palsy, when a missile hit their sixth-floor apartment. Two other Palestinians were injured in the attack, one of them severely.

Name: Ahmad 'Abd al-Fatah Suliman Suliman
Notes: Member of the PA security forces. Fatally shot by soldiers while in the car of another member who, according to media reports, was severely wounded in the shooting. Israel held his body until 12 May 2021.

Name: Aysar 'Abd a-Rahim Taha al-Halabi
Notes: בכיר בזרוע הצבאית של חמאס. נהרג בביתו. גופתו נמצאה ב-19.5.21.

Name: Salim Muhammad Salim al-Farra
Notes: Injured by a missile while on the street in the al-Manarah neighborhood with other Humat al-Aqsa military wing operatives.

Name: Muhammad 'Abdallah Fayad
Notes: Killed on farmland in the al-Bura area east of Beit Hanoun.

Name: Muayad Ahmad Muhammad Hamdan
Notes: Killed while walking along the street, by an airstrike on the home of the Hamad family in the town.

Name: 'Abd a-Rahman Nazem Khaled a-Najar
Notes: Killed in a tunnel along with eight other Hamas military wing operatives, one of them a senior member. His body was extracted on 21 May 2021.

Name: Muhammad Rashid Khamis a-Najar
Notes: Killed in a tunnel along with eight other Hamas military wing operatives, one of them a senior member. His body was extracted on 21 May 2021.

Name: Wael Mahmoud Ibrahim Sleih
Notes: Killed in a tunnel along with eight other Hamas military wing operatives, one of them a senior member. His body was extracted on 21 May 2021.

Name: Amjad Fouad Ahmad Kaware'
Notes: Killed in a tunnel along with eight other Hamas military wing operatives, one of them a senior member. His body was extracted on 21 May 2021.

Name: Tareq Musa 'Abdallah Abu Mustafa
Notes: Killed in a tunnel along with eight other Hamas military wing operatives, one of them a senior member. His body was extracted on 21 May 2021.

Name: Muhammad Yunes Ibrahim Abu Hijazi
Notes: Killed in a tunnel along with eight other Hamas military wing operatives, one of them a senior member. His body was extracted on 21 May 2021.

Name: Fahed Jamal Hussein al-Farra
Notes: Killed in a tunnel along with eight other Hamas military wing operatives, one of them a senior member. His body was extracted on 21 May 2021.

Name: 'Abdallah Ahmad Ibrahim Abu Khater
Notes: Senior Hamas military wing operative. Killed in a tunnel along with eight other Hamas military wing operatives. His body was extracted on 21 May 2021.

Name: Muamen 'Omar Suliman Abu a-Naja
Notes: Killed in a tunnel along with eight other Hamas military wing operatives, one of them a senior member. His body was extracted on 21 May 2021.

Name: Saber Ibrahim Mahmoud Suliman
Notes: Senior Hamas military wing operative. Killed by a missile along with his son, a minor, while the two were on farmland.

Name: Muhammad Saber Ibrahim Suliman
Notes: Killed by a missile along with his father, a senior Hamas military wing operative, while the two were on farmland.

Name: Muhammad Ahmad 'Abed Abu 'Amshah
Notes: Killed in an airstrike on a Hamas military wing outpost. His body was extracted about two days later.

Name: Taha Mahmoud Taher al-'Aqad
Notes: Killed along with eight other Hamas military wing operatives, including two senior operatives, in an airstrike on a tunnel. His body was extracted on 21 May 2021.

Name: Munib Majed Ibrahim Abu Mustafa
Notes: Killed along with eight other Hamas military wing operatives, including two senior operatives, in an airstrike on a tunnel. His body was extracted on 21 May 2021.

Name: Mahmoud Kamal Ibrahim Kulab
Notes: Killed along with eight other Hamas military wing operatives, including two senior operatives, in an airstrike on a tunnel. His body was extracted on 21 May 2021.

Name: Munib Mahmoud Ahmad Hamdan
Notes: Killed along with eight other Hamas military wing operatives, including two senior operatives, in an airstrike on a tunnel. His body was extracted on 21 May 2021.
